required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Photon/Proton Radiation Therapy for Cancers of the Nasal Cavity and/or Paranasal Sinuses
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Outcomes Protocol of Photon/Proton Beam Radiation Therapy for Cancers of the Nasal Cavity and/or Paranasal Sinuses

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect information from a questionnaire and medical records to see what effects proton radiation has on cancer and collect and analyze morbidity outcomes: incidence of Xerostomia (dry mouth) and tumor control.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is non interventional outcomes protocol designed to collect information from a questionnaire and medical records to see what effects proton radiation has on cancer and collect and analyze morbidity outcomes: incidence of Xerostomia (dry mouth) and tumor control.

primary_outcome.measure: Grade 3 or higher of xerostomia Incidence of Xerostomia
primary_outcome.time_frame: One year after the end of radiation therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collect and analyze tumor control outcomes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: When each patient has been followed for a minimum of 12 months with final analysis after 24 months.

arm_group.description: All of the tests, procedures and treatments may be considered standard of care for someone with this type of cancer, except for the Xerostomia Questionnaire.

intervention.description: All of the tests, procedures and treatments may be considered standard of care for someone with this type of cancer, except for the Xerostomia Questionnaire.

study_pop.textblock: Patients in the Radiation Oncology Clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cancer of nasal cavity and/or paranasal sinuses.
- Will receive treatment with proton radiation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of distant metastasis.
- Previous radiation for head and neck cancer.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

facility.name: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

link.description: Contact the University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute
